citations.narrative:
The facility described cleaning procedure did not match the last recorded sanitization record of Mar 6th 2025. Routine
sanitization of the primary enclosures with a safe and effective disinfectant prevents the spread of disease and ensures
the welfare of the animals. Enclosures shall be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks.
Correct by: 13 Aug 2025

Hazardous conditions were noted in the Serval and Porcupine enclosures. There were several unprotected power cords
in the room in which the Serval was being housed. The Serval is currently free to roam inside a bedroom of the house
when outdoor temperatures are >100 deg F. Several charging cords, a fan power cord, and a heater power cord are all
plugged in and accessible to the Serval. There were also several exposed sharp edges on the plastic wire wheel in the
porcupine enclosure. Sharp edges and power cords are a potential risk to the health and welfare of the animals.
Enclosures must be maintained in good repair and protect the animals from injury.
Correct by: 15 Aug 2025

The Kinkajou enclosure was unsanitary, containing excessive amounts of feces and soiled straw. Enclosures with
unsanitary conditions and excessive amounts of feces put the animals at risk of increased disease exposure due to
contact with feces and potential flying and ground pests. The regulations state that excreta shall be removed from primary
enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease
hazards and to reduce odors.
Correct by: 12 Aug 2025

The current pest control program is ineffective. Rodent droppings were observed on and around the milk crate containing
clean food bowls as well as on top of a chest freezer in the food preparation area. The facility currently uses peanut
butter-based recipe deterrent. Pests such as small rodents can spread disease and contaminate food. A safe and
effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and
maintained.
Correct by 12 August 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

Hazardous conditions were noted in the Serval and Porcupine enclosures. There were several unprotected power cords

The Kinkajou enclosure was unsanitary, containing excessive amounts of feces and soiled straw. Enclosures with

Correct by: 12 Aug 2025 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation.

The current pest control program is ineffective. Rodent droppings were observed on and around the milk crate containing

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
